info.name: Data API vector collection
info.description: To execute Data API commands in this **public preview** release: 1. In DataStax [Astra Portal](https://astra.datastax.com/), create a vector-enabled **Astra DB Serverless** database. 2. When your database is Active, generate an **Application Token**. It's automatically associated with the Database Administrator role. Copy and/or download the token's value. Also take note of the **API Endpoint** that is specific to your created database. 3. Define **local variables** here in Postman with values specific to your vector-enabled Astra DB Serverless database. In the Data API calls here in Postman, you'll need the appropriate values for **ASTRA_DB_APPLICATION_TOKEN** and the **ASTRA_DB_API_ENDPOINT**. 1. In Astra Portal, on your database's Overview tab, generate an auth token; copy and use that value in an ASTRA_DB_APPLICATION_TOKEN local variable in Postman. 2. Also in Astra Portal, copy your ASTRA_DB_API_ENDPOINT value from your database's Overview tab. Define that local variable in Postman. 3. An ASTRA_DB_API_ENDPOINT has this format: _https://{{ASTRA_DB_ID}}-{{ASTRA_DB_REGION}}.apps.astra.datastax.com_ 4. Also define local variables for an **ASTRA_DB_KEYSPACE**, and an **ASTRA_DB_COLLECTION** name. 1. An ASTRA_DB_KEYSPACE example: default_keyspace, which is present by default in your vector-enabled database. 2. An ASTRA_DB_COLLECTION example: vector_collection 5. In Postman, only change the **Current value** of your local variables. And be sure to **Save** the local variable definitions. 6. Download and install the [Postman app,](https://www.postman.com/downloads/) if you haven't already. **TIP:** Notice in the Data API commands: - The fully qualified url path -- before the collection has been created, or when you want to find or delete an existing collection -- is: _ASTRA_DB_API_ENDPOINT_/api/json/v1/_ASTRA_DB_KEYSPACE_ - Once the collection has been created, the fully qualified url path is: _ASTRA_DB_API_ENDPOINT_/api/json/v1/_ASTRA_DB_KEYSPACE_/_ASTRA_DB_COLLECTION_ After stepping through all the commands, you can reset the example data and start over by executing the final call, deleteCollection. **About local variables:** Here's an example of the local Variables UI in Postman (with redacted ID values) for a vector-enabled Astra DB Serverless database:

item.name: Create and find collections
createCollection with vector options
findCollections

item.description: Prerequisite: If you haven't already, create a vector-enabled Astra DB Serverless database in [Astra Portal](https://astra.datastax.com). On the **Create Vector Database** dialog, enter a database name, and choose a cloud provider and region. Then here in Postman, define local variables as explained on the Overview tab of "Data API vector collection."

insertOne document with $vector
verify insertOne with find
insertMany documents with $vector

item.name: find to return multiple documents: filter by online purchase_type
Find using property stored in an array, filtered by warranty type
Find with multi-column filter for customers from specific city and state
Find with $and $or to filter whether seller and customer match given values
Find with $in to query city
Find with $exists where property is present
Find with $eq where document equals purchases by given seller’s name and location
Find with $ne where documents have cars purchased by customers not residing in New Yor
Find with $not to find documents that do not match the filter
Find with $nin where seller.location does not contain specified values
Find with range operators $gte and $lt
find with $size: filter to get purchases with 3 items
Find with $all where array has two given items
Find with $eq where array has only given data
Find pagination example to get first 20 documents on page 1
find with pagingState: to get all purchases showing Page 2 results

item.description: Data API commands that find data. Operators are used in many of these find command examples.

item.name: Find and modify data
findOneAndUpdate with $sort and $set for active status
findOneAndUpdate - upsert--> Query: Set array of tags, multi data type
findOneAndUpdate - unset--> Query: Unset amount from the document
findOneAndUpdate - inc--> Query: Decrease wait list by 1
findOneAndUpdate  - push --> Query: Add data to tags
findOneAndUpdate  - pop --> Query: Remove last data to tags array
findOneAndUpdate  - each - Add multiple elements to array
findOneAndUpdate  - position - Add element to a particular position
findOneAndUpdate  - min and max - no update
findOneAndUpdate  - min and max - Update value
findOneAndUpdate  - addToSet - Add's data to array if value not part of the array
findOneAndUpdate  - Rename a field
findOneAndDelete with vector

item.description: Data API commands that find and modify data.

item.description: Data API commands that delete data, including an example that deletes the entire collection so that you can start over with the examples.
